title: 'Trump, hands off Greenland!': From Nuuk to Copenhagen, thousands rally against US annexation plan
subhead: Thousands marched in the capitals of Greenland and Denmark, united in their rejection of Donald Trump's expansionist ambitions for the Inuit island.

title: From Monroe to Trump: Two centuries of US interference in Latin America
By appearing with a royal heiress, Jordan Bardella risks blurring his image
Trump threatens Europe with tariffs over Greenland as protesters rally
subhead: Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the UK, the Netherlands and Finland would be subject to a 10% tariff on all goods sent to the US, Donald Trump said in a Truth Social post on Saturday, as thousands demonstrated in the capital of Greenland against his plans.

title: EU and Mercosur sign 'historic' free trade deal
subhead: Saturday's signing ceremony in Paraguay's capital of Asunción marks a major geopolitical victory for the EU in an age of American tariffs and surging Chinese exports. 'The geopolitical importance of this agreement cannot be overstated,' said Commission President Ursula von der Leyen.

title: French Response, the foreign ministry's X account for trolling disinformation
subhead: Since 2025, the unconventional X account French Response has delivered sharp English-language retorts and headline-grabbing moments on the social network. Experts call it an effective way to counter attempts at foreign interference, though it raises questions about its long-term usefulness.

title: Henrique Gouveia e Melo, the admiral who wants to lead Portugal
subhead: Revealed during the Covid-19 pandemic, former military officer Henrique Gouveia e Melo is in the race for the January 18 presidential election. He has attracted voters with his talk of reform, despite his limited grasp of political conventions.

Mercosur trade deal will have uneven effects on EU countries
subhead: From Dutch ultra-productivism to Greek micro-farms, European agriculture – already weakened by climate change, animal epidemics and competition – has struggled to present a united front in response to the free trade agreement.

title: Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
subhead: The former head of artificial intelligence research at Meta explains his decision to start a new company focused on the physical world, citing strategic differences with the American tech giant and predicting a 'third AI revolution' in the coming years.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear white in winter?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.
